text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Atari 5200 is the video game console version of the Atari 400 computer, released in 1982. It competed against the Intellivision and ColecoVision, beating them in value. The 5200 is considered a commercial failure, being discontinued after two years on the market. It is equipped with a MOS 6502C CPU at 1.79MHz, 16KB of RAM and 4-way sound, displaying a resolution of 320x192 in 128 colors (16 colors with 8 intensity levels). It also featured an 360-degree non-centering joystick and a total of 4 controller ports.
